content.question: Construct and interpret a 95 percent confidence interval for the population mean difference in age (age of grandmother minus age of grandfather) of the maternal grandparents of high school students. One of the sociologist’s research questions was about the mean difference in age without regard to which grandparent is older. The interval constructed in part (a) does not address such a question. Based on the sample of high school students, give the value of the point estimate for the mean difference in age that could be used to address the sociologist’s question.

frqParts.text: Construct and interpret a 95 percent confidence interval for the population mean difference in age (age of grandmother minus age of grandfather) of the maternal grandparents of high school students. One of the sociologist’s research questions was about the mean difference in age without regard to which grandparent is older. The interval constructed in part (a) does not address such a question. Based on the sample of high school students, give the value of the point estimate for the mean difference in age that could be used to address the sociologist’s question.

topic.text: 7.2: Constructing a Confidence Interval for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate inference method for confidence intervals.
